competitors.name: Microsoft Teams
competitors.notes: Business communication platform part of Microsoft 365, enjoyed healthy growth spike throughout 2020, supports up to 300 members with guest access and shared files up to 10GB per team in free tier

competitors.name: Google Meet
competitors.notes: Made free to all users worldwide in May 2020 (previously paid service for educators) to compete with Zoom, supports up to 100 participants with 16 visible at a time, integrated with G Suite

competitors.name: Skype
competitors.notes: Microsoft's popular video chat platform, supports up to 50 participants for unlimited time for free, has call recording feature with recordings saved for up to a month

competitors.name: Cisco Webex
competitors.notes: Big name in corporate video conferencing with impressive boardroom credentials, dominated market before pandemic along with Polycom and Avaya, offers crystal-clear calls and instant messaging with collaboration tools

competitors.name: GoToMeeting
competitors.notes: Web conferencing service from LogMeIn with audio/video sessions, screen sharing, and mobile apps for Android and iOS, standard version allows up to 150 team members for $14/month or $12/month annually

competitors.name: Jitsi Meet
competitors.notes: Leading open source competitor developed by 8x8, utilizes WebRTC technology for encrypted video calls running directly in browser without downloads or plugins

competitors.name: Polycom
competitors.notes: Dominated video conferencing market before the pandemic alongside Cisco and Avaya

competitors.name: Avaya
competitors.notes: Dominated video conferencing market before the pandemic alongside Cisco and Polycom

context: Zoom Video Communications, Inc. is a video communications platform company focused on video meetings, webinars, and collaboration tools. COVID pandemic surge. Became verb for video calls.
